metadata.title: CVE-2017-5080 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free in credit card autofill in Google Chrome prior to59.0.3071.86 for Linux and Windows allowed a remote attacker to perform anout of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5080` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu0.16.04.1289').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
